vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
ἐπιτιμ-άω,
Ionic dialect and Delph. ἐπιτιμέω, [Refs 5th c.BC+]:— lay a value upon: hence,
__1 show honour to, τινά Hdt. [prev. cited]
__2 raise in price, οἶνον ἐ. πολύ [Refs 4th c.BC+]; τὴν αἴτησιν ἐ. raise the demand, [Refs]:—passive, rise in price, of corn, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II of judges, lay a penalty on a person, τοῖς ἐξάρνοις ἐ. ταλάντου ἑκάστῳ variant in [Refs 4th c.BC+]; but ἐ. τὴν ἀρχαίην δίκην make the original trial the ground of punishment, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2 object to one as blameable, τινί τι [Refs 5th c.BC+]:—passive, [Refs 4th c.BC+]
__II.2.b with accusative of things only, censure, οὐ τοῦτ᾽ ἐπιτιμῶ [Refs 4th c.BC+]:—passive, τὸ..ὑπὸ τῶν πολλῶν ἐπιτιμώμενον [Refs 5th c.BC+]
__II.2.c with dative only, rebuke, censure, of persons, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; of things, τοῖς ψηφισθεῖσιν [NT+5th c.BC+]:— passive, ἐπιτετιμημένος ἐπί τινι [Refs 2nd c.BC+]
__II.2.d absolutely, λόγῳ καλῶς ἐ. by word, [Refs 5th c.BC+]
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
to rebuke, warn
primarily to set a value upon; to assess a penalty; to allege as a crimination; hence, to reprove, chide, censure, rebuke, reprimand, Mt. 19:13; Lk. 23:40; in NT to admonish strongly, enjoin strictly, Mt. 12:16; Lk. 17:3
